name: parochially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows interest only in a narrow range of matters, especially those that directly affect yourself, your town, or your country: The colleges have become parochially interested in their own well-being. She is viewing the situation nationally, not parochially. See
parochial
More examplesFewer examplesIt is wise not to think too parochially.Mount Abu is Rajasthan's only hill station and, more parochially, a popular destination for honeymooners.We must continue to develop human talent, whether parochially, nationally or globally.
